1.text: My soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint on myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.

2.text: I will say to God, Do not condemn me; show me why you contend with me.

3.text: Is it good to you that you should oppress, that you should despise the work of your hands, and shine on the counsel of the wicked?

4.text: Have you eyes of flesh? or see you as man sees?

5.text: Are your days as the days of man? are your years as manâ€™s days,

6.text: That you enquire after my iniquity, and search after my sin?

7.text: You know that I am not wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of your hand.

8.text: Your hands have made me and fashioned me together round about; yet you do destroy me.

9.text: Remember, I beseech you, that you have made me as the clay; and will you bring me into dust again?

10.text: Have you not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?

11.text: You have clothed me with skin and flesh, and have fenced me with bones and sinews.

12.text: You have granted me life and favor, and your visitation has preserved my spirit.

13.text: And these things have you hid in your heart: I know that this is with you.

14.text: If I sin, then you mark me, and you will not acquit me from my iniquity.

15.text: If I be wicked, woe to me; and if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up my head. I am full of confusion; therefore see you my affliction;

16.text: For it increases. You hunt me as a fierce lion: and again you show yourself marvelous on me.

17.text: You renew your witnesses against me, and increase your indignation on me; changes and war are against me.

18.text: Why then have you brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!

19.text: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.

20.text: Are not my days few? cease then, and let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,

21.text: Before I go from where I shall not return, even to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;

22.text: A land of darkness, as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.
